title: Finding the X- and Y- Intercepts
text: $$3x+y=6$$. The x-intercept can be calculated by the equation $$3x=6$$, and the y-intercept can be calculated by the equation $$y=6$$. Solving these equations, we get the x-intercept as $$2$$ and the y-intercept as $$6$$. $$2+6=8$$
